snippet: The federal appeals court ruling contrasted sharply with recent decisions by other state and federal courts defending states’ rights to keep information about lethal injection drug sources secret.
abstract: Federal appeals court delays execution of Arizona man Joseph Wood, saying he has legal right to details about lethal injection drugs to be used and about qualifications of execution team; ruling comes four days before scheduled execution.
lead_paragraph: The federal appeals court ruling contrasted sharply with recent decisions by other state and federal courts defending states’ rights to keep information about lethal injection drug sources secret.

headline.main: Court Delays Execution Over Secrecy With Drugs
headline.print_headline: Court Delays Execution Over Secrecy With Drugs
